ms_copies_parts: Naples, Conservatorio. Two copies: 22.2.10, 'Quartetto no. 2...', and 22.5.6, 'Quartetto no. 6... per uso di S. E. Abbate Don Antonio Giorgio'
sources.first_edition: December, 1769, Paris, Venier: Op. 6 no. 5 (for title, see No. 165)
later_editions: (c. 1770), London, Longman Lukey: Op. 4 no. 5 (for title, see No. 166)
(c. 1775), London, Bremner: Op. 6 no. 5 (for title, see No. 166)
(c. 1780), Amsterdam, Hummel: Op. 2 no. 5 (for title, see No. 166)
(c. 1785), Paris, Boyer-Naderman: Op. 6 no. 5 (for title, see No. 165)
sources.modern_edition: 1953, Milan, Ricordi: Op. 6 no. 5 (pocket score; revised by Enrico Polo). The movements are in a different order: Andantino—Minuetto—Allegro

entries.notes: Arrangement: Of the whole quartet, as a quartet (no. 2) for flute, clarinet, horn and bassoon, by O. Van den Broeck, c. 1820 (see No. 263)
